text: Hi, I got a question. Using the HubSpot API, how can I get the count of `contacts` for example ? I know it's doable as it is present on the frontend
How to use HubSpot client api gem to respond to a fetch url from crm cards in rails

on a hunch, I made `idProperty` undefined, and got back the info I needed! I really wish the documentation had more examples of what actually goes in these fields. I'm finding that I still don't know what `idProperty` means.

i’ve never had to do that, and i don’t see that it’s directly possible. but the first 10 results on this google search provide some direction on workarounds.

<https://www.google.com/search?q=HubSpot+contacts+api+count&oq=HubSpot+contacts+api+count&aqs=chrome..69i57j33i160.7050j1j1&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8>
Hi, I have a question. I got an error this morning 'The email address in the 'to' field failed validation' of contacts. What is the issue of that?

Hey. I have a very slow answer from HubSpot API plugin for Wordpress to my site.  I am using the Plugin to collect data for the Contact Form. But I am trying to improve the site speed on the site - and the API is just very slow answer and is slowing down the whole site and the landing pages.  How can i fix this?  Any idea?

is there a schema available for the CRM Products and Line Items APIs? they seem *extremely* incorrect in the docs <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/line-items> and the client libraries have, effectively, no typing
for example, *`discounts`* aren’t mentioned *at all* in the line item docs
i see those legacy rumors are true

Hi, does anyone know if properties for the contact endpoint: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/create_contact> correspond to the HubSpot default fields? The lowercasing and 'firstname' and 'lastname' examples are making me unsure how the properties should be formatted
